content.description: I'm not 100% sure about the grade on this one.  If you go straight up the slab and stay away from either arete, which are both their own seperate problem, then i think it's not only hard but horrifying as well.  Get's 800 comp points if that's any indication of the grade, which i'm not sure it is.  If you bail out right toward the top it's a little more managable but still has quite a pucker facctor.
content.location: The tall, proud slab of the central boulder in the Beautiful Day Cluster.

content.description: The area warm up.  Start sitting on the lower block, move out the roof, mantle on the boulder, and up the mossy slab/arete.  Just put your feet where the green ain't.  Not as scary as the rest of the problems here, and not a bad beginner route.
content.protection: Pads/Spotters.  The ground rises along the right side of the climb.
content.location: Far right arete of the rightmost boulder in the beautiful day area.

content.description: Another great problem ascending the arete of the boulder to the right of Beautiful Day.  Start on obvious holds and work your way up the arete then transition onto the slab and top it out.  It's possible to bail onto the beautiful day boulder if you get sketched, but i think the hardest moves are lower.  That being said it's scary as hell up there.
content.protection: a few pads and spotters.  it's tall and if you blew it at the top i think the fall would be weird.
content.location: Left Arete of the center boulder in the B-Day cluster.  Next problem to the right of Beautiful Day.

content.description: This is the hand crack formed by the meeting point of the central and rightmost boulder in the Beautiful Day cluster.  It's probably 5.7ish, has a few rad hand jams, and is pretty darn amazing.  Just make sure you're solid, because like all the other problems here it's quite tall. If you don't know how to jam it's going to be significantly harder.
content.location: Obvious hand crack to the right of the tall slab of the central boulder in the cluster.

content.description: The reason you'd come to this area.  Start matched on obvious high start hold and work your way through crimps and gastons to a jug, then make a long reach high to a side pull and on to an easy top out.  Great Problem!
content.protection: A few pads and spotters.  The landing is okay but the problem is pretty tall
content.location: If you're looking at the boulders, this is the face on the left

content.description: This is a not often visited cluster of a few very tall boulders near the remnants of the old tower house.  Beautiful Day, an absolutely classic V7ish face climb is the area's flagship problem, but there are also a few others up there worth doing.  All the climbs are tall, so be sure to come prepared.
